oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Soldiers from the 118th Infantry Regiment

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: World War 1914-1918; Military personnel; Soldiers; Military uniforms; Women; Gas masks; Rifles; War
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Americans from the 118th Regiment Infantry (formerly First South Carolina Infantry, detachment First North Carolina Infantry, and Second South Carolina Infantry), 30th Division, passing through Brancourt le Grand, Aisne. The soldiers are standing in; line outside a building getting coffee or tea from an older women. One soldier is carrying a bayonet over his shoulder and looking at the camera. All soldiers are holding tin cups in their hands. Bags containing gas masks are fastened to their chests.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States. Army. Signal Corps
